thread.title: Ground News - Surveillance video helps detectives find 2 men accused of stealing over $12K worth of items from Conroe residence
thread.title_full: Ground News - Surveillance video helps detectives find 2 men accused of stealing over $12K worth of items from Conroe residence

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Surveillance video helps detectives find 2 men accused of stealing over $12K worth of items from Conroe residence
text:
Summary by Ground News Two men were caught on camera stealing multiple tools and dirt bikes from a residence. Surveillance video showed the men taking the items worth over $12,000. Shane Null, 38, and Ronnie Rogers, 52, both of Porter, confessed to the burglary. Null was charged with burglary of a building and possession of a controlled substance. Share menu More

KPRC-TV Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Graham Holdings Surveillance video helps detectives find 2 men accused of stealing over $12K worth of items from Conroe residence Two men were caught on camera stealing multiple tools and dirt bikes from a residence in Conroe on Dec. 20, according to the Montgomery County Sheriff’s Office District 3 Patrol Division.
